text: Darrall Tucker Imhoff (October 11, 1938 - June 30, 2017) was an American former professional basketball player. He spent twelve seasons in the NBA (1960â€“72), playing for six teams. Imhoff was the starting center for the New York Knicks, and played for 20 minutes in the game when Wilt Chamberlain scored an NBA personal scoring record of 100 points. Imhoff died on June 30, 2017 in Bend, Oregon of a heart attack at the age of 78.Darrall Imhoff Passes Away at 78 ==References== ==Other websites== *Darrall Imhoff Profile and Stats at LakersWeb.com Category:1938 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:New York Knicks players Category:Detroit Pistons players Category:Los Angeles Lakers players Category:Philadelphia 76ers players Category:Sacramento Kings players Category:Portland Trail Blazers players Category:Sportspeople from California Category:Sportspeople from Oregon
